verses.kjv: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judaea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of Ituraea and of the region of Trachonitis, and Lysanias the tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.web: Now in the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being governor of Judea, and Herod being tetrarch of Galilee, and his brother Philip tetrarch of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias tetrarch of Abilene,
verses.ct: It was the 15th year of Emperor Tiberius Caesar's reign. Pontius Pilate was governor of Judaea, Herod was tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip was tetrarch of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias was tetrarch of Abilene.

verses.kjv: Annas and Caiaphas being the high priests, the word of God came unto John the son of Zacharias in the wilderness.
verses.web: in the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, in the wilderness.
verses.ct: Annas and Caiaphas were serving as high priests. During this time, the word of God came to John, the son of Zacharias, out in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: And he came into all the country about Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins;
verses.web: He came into all the region around the Jordan, preaching the baptism of repentance for remission of sins.
verses.ct: John traveled throughout the region around the Jordan River, preaching that people should be baptized as a sign of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

verses.kjv: As it is written in the book of the words of Esaias the prophet, saying, The voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
verses.web: As it is written in the book of the words of Isaiah the prophet, “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.
verses.ct: This fulfilled what was written in the book of the prophet Esaias: "A voice is calling out in the wilderness, 'Prepare the way of the Lord! Make his paths straight.

verses.kjv: Every valley shall be filled, and every mountain and hill shall be brought low; and the crooked shall be made straight, and the rough ways shall be made smooth;
verses.web: Every valley will be filled. Every mountain and hill will be brought low. The crooked will become straight, and the rough ways smooth.
verses.ct: Every valley will be filled in, and every mountain and hill will be leveled. The crooked roads will be straightened, and the rough paths will be made smooth.

verses.kjv: And all flesh shall see the salvation of God.
verses.web: All flesh will see God’s salvation.’ ”
verses.ct: And all people everywhere will see the salvation of God.'"

verses.kjv: Then said he to the multitude that came forth to be baptized of him, O generation of vipers, who hath warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.web: He said therefore to the multitudes who went out to be baptized by him, “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?
verses.ct: Crowds of people came out to be baptized by John, but he confronted them: "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to run from the coming wrath?

verses.kjv: Bring forth therefore fruits worthy of repentance, and begin not to say within yourselves, We have Abraham to our father: for I say unto you, That God is able of these stones to raise up children unto Abraham.
verses.web: Therefore produce fruits worthy of repentance, and don’t begin to say among yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father;’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones!
verses.ct: Prove your repentance by the way you live. And don't start telling yourselves, 'We're safe because Abraham is our ancestor.' Let me tell you — God could turn these stones into children of Abraham!

verses.kjv: And now also the axe is laid unto the root of the trees: every tree therefore which bringeth not forth good fruit is hewn down, and cast into the fire.
verses.web: Even now the ax also lies at the root of the trees. Every tree therefore that doesn’t produce good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.”
verses.ct: The axe is already at the root of the trees. Every tree that doesn't produce good fruit will be chopped down and thrown into the fire."

verses.kjv: And the people asked him, saying, What shall we do then?
verses.web: The multitudes asked him, “What then must we do?”
verses.ct: The people in the crowd asked him, "Then what should we do?"

verses.kjv: He answereth and saith unto them, He that hath two coats, let him impart to him that hath none; and he that hath meat, let him do likewise.
verses.web: He answered them, “He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none. He who has food, let him do likewise.”
verses.ct: He answered, "If you have 2 coats, give one to someone who has none. If you have food, share it."

verses.kjv: Then came also publicans to be baptized, and said unto him, Master, what shall we do?
verses.web: Tax collectors also came to be baptized, and they said to him, “Teacher, what must we do?”
verses.ct: Even tax collectors came to be baptized and asked him, "Teacher, what should we do?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Exact no more than that which is appointed you.
verses.web: He said to them, “Collect no more than that which is appointed to you.”
verses.ct: He told them, "Don't collect anything more than what you're authorized to collect."

verses.kjv: And the soldiers likewise demanded of him, saying, And what shall we do? And he said unto them, Do violence to no man, neither accuse any falsely; and be content with your wages.
verses.web: Soldiers also asked him, saying, “What about us? What must we do?” He said to them, “Extort from no one by violence, neither accuse anyone wrongfully. Be content with your wages.”
verses.ct: Some soldiers asked him too, "What about us? What should we do?" He said, "Don't extort money from anyone or make false accusations. Be satisfied with your pay."

verses.kjv: And as the people were in expectation, and all men mused in their hearts of John, whether he were the Christ, or not;
verses.web: As the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether perhaps he was the Christ,
verses.ct: The people were filled with anticipation, and everyone was wondering in their hearts whether John might be the Christ.

verses.kjv: John answered, saying unto them all, I indeed baptize you with water; but one mightier than I cometh, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to unloose: he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost and with fire:
verses.web: John answered them all, “I indeed baptize you with water, but he comes who is mightier than I, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to loosen. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and fire,
verses.ct: John addressed them all: "I baptize you with water, but someone far more powerful than me is coming. I'm not even worthy to untie the straps of his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.

verses.kjv: Whose fan is in his hand, and he will throughly purge his floor, and will gather the wheat into his garner; but the chaff he will burn with fire unquenchable.
verses.web: whose fan is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor, and will gather the wheat into his barn; but he will burn up the chaff with unquenchable fire.”
verses.ct: He has his winnowing fork in hand, ready to thoroughly clean his threshing floor. He'll gather the wheat into his barn, but the chaff he'll burn with fire that never goes out."

verses.kjv: And many other things in his exhortation preached he unto the people.
verses.web: Then with many other exhortations he preached good news to the people,
verses.ct: With many other urgent appeals like these, John proclaimed the good news to the people.

verses.kjv: But Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias his brother Philip’s wife, and for all the evils which Herod had done,
verses.web: but Herod the tetrarch, being reproved by him for Herodias, his brother’s wife, and for all the evil things which Herod had done,
verses.ct: But when John rebuked Herod the tetrarch for marrying Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, and for all the other evil things Herod had done,

verses.kjv: Added yet this above all, that he shut up John in prison.
verses.web: added this also to them all, that he shut up John in prison.
verses.ct: Herod added one more crime to the list — he locked John up in prison.

verses.kjv: Now when all the people were baptized, it came to pass, that Jesus also being baptized, and praying, the heaven was opened,
verses.web: Now when all the people were baptized, Jesus also had been baptized, and was praying. The sky was opened,
verses.ct: Before that happened, when all the people were being baptized, Jesus was baptized too. As he was praying, heaven opened up,

verses.kjv: And the Holy Ghost descended in a bodily shape like a dove upon him, and a voice came from heaven, which said, Thou art my beloved Son; in thee I am well pleased.
verses.web: and the Holy Spirit descended in a bodily form like a dove on him; and a voice came out of the sky, saying “You are my beloved Son. In you I am well pleased.”
verses.ct: and the Holy Spirit came down on him in a visible form like a dove. Then a voice spoke from heaven: "You are my beloved Son; in you I am well pleased."

verses.kjv: And Jesus himself began to be about thirty years of age, being (as was supposed) the son of Joseph, which was the son of Heli,
verses.web: Jesus himself, when he began to teach, was about thirty years old, being the son (as was supposed) of Joseph, the son of Heli,
verses.ct: Jesus was about 30 years old when he began his ministry. He was known as the son of Joseph, who was the son of Heli,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Matthat, which was the son of Levi, which was the son of Melchi, which was the son of Janna, which was the son of Joseph,
verses.web: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Jannai, the son of Joseph,
verses.ct: the son of Matthat, the son of Levi, the son of Melchi, the son of Janna, the son of Joseph,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Mattathias, which was the son of Amos, which was the son of Naum, which was the son of Esli, which was the son of Nagge,
verses.web: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Nahum, the son of Esli, the son of Naggai,
verses.ct: the son of Mattathias, the son of Amos, the son of Naum, the son of Esli, the son of Nagge,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Maath, which was the son of Mattathias, which was the son of Semei, which was the son of Joseph, which was the son of Juda,
verses.web: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semein, the son of Joseph, the son of Judah,
verses.ct: the son of Maath, the son of Mattathias, the son of Semei, the son of Joseph, the son of Juda,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Joanna, which was the son of Rhesa, which was the son of Zorobabel, which was the son of Salathiel, which was the son of Neri,
verses.web: the son of Joanan, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zerubbabel, the son of Shealtiel, the son of Neri,
verses.ct: the son of Joanna, the son of Rhesa, the son of Zorobabel, the son of Salathiel, the son of Neri,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Melchi, which was the son of Addi, which was the son of Cosam, which was the son of Elmodam, which was the son of Er,
verses.web: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,
verses.ct: the son of Melchi, the son of Addi, the son of Cosam, the son of Elmodam, the son of Er,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Jose, which was the son of Eliezer, which was the son of Jorim, which was the son of Matthat, which was the son of Levi,
verses.web: the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,
verses.ct: the son of Jose, the son of Eliezer, the son of Jorim, the son of Matthat, the son of Levi,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Simeon, which was the son of Juda, which was the son of Joseph, which was the son of Jonan, which was the son of Eliakim,
verses.web: the son of Simeon, the son of Judah, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,
verses.ct: the son of Simeon, the son of Juda, the son of Joseph, the son of Jonan, the son of Eliakim,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Melea, which was the son of Menan, which was the son of Mattatha, which was the son of Nathan, which was the son of David,
verses.web: the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,
verses.ct: the son of Melea, the son of Menan, the son of Mattatha, the son of Nathan, the son of David,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Jesse, which was the son of Obed, which was the son of Booz, which was the son of Salmon, which was the son of Naasson,
verses.web: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Boaz, the son of Salmon, the son of Nahshon,
verses.ct: the son of Jesse, the son of Obed, the son of Booz, the son of Salmon, the son of Naasson,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Aminadab, which was the son of Aram, which was the son of Esrom, which was the son of Phares, which was the son of Juda,
verses.web: the son of Amminadab, the son of Aram, the son of Hezron, the son of Perez, the son of Judah,
verses.ct: the son of Aminadab, the son of Aram, the son of Esrom, the son of Phares, the son of Juda,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Jacob, which was the son of Isaac, which was the son of Abraham, which was the son of Thara, which was the son of Nachor,
verses.web: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Terah, the son of Nahor,
verses.ct: the son of Jacob, the son of Isaac, the son of Abraham, the son of Thara, the son of Nachor,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Saruch, which was the son of Ragau, which was the son of Phalec, which was the son of Heber, which was the son of Sala,
verses.web: the son of Serug, the son of Reu, the son of Peleg, the son of Eber, the son of Shelah,
verses.ct: the son of Saruch, the son of Ragau, the son of Phalec, the son of Heber, the son of Sala,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Cainan, which was the son of Arphaxad, which was the son of Sem, which was the son of Noe, which was the son of Lamech,
verses.web: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Shem, the son of Noah, the son of Lamech,
verses.ct: the son of Cainan, the son of Arphaxad, the son of Sem, the son of Noe, the son of Lamech,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Mathusala, which was the son of Enoch, which was the son of Jared, which was the son of Maleleel, which was the son of Cainan,
verses.web: the son of Methuselah, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Mahalaleel, the son of Cainan,
verses.ct: the son of Mathusala, the son of Enoch, the son of Jared, the son of Maleleel, the son of Cainan,

verses.kjv: Which was the son of Enos, which was the son of Seth, which was the son of Adam, which was the son of God.
verses.web: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
verses.ct: the son of Enos, the son of Seth, the son of Adam, the son of God.
